javadoc: RecordIterator provides the ability to iterate over data records within a table.

methods.javadoc:
Return true if a Record is available in the forward direction.
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: hasNext
methods.comment: Return true if a Record is available in the forward direction.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.javadoc:
Return true if a Record is available in the reverse direction
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: hasPrevious
methods.comment: Return true if a Record is available in the reverse direction

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.javadoc:
Return the nexy Record or null if one is not available.
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: next
methods.comment: Return the nexy Record or null if one is not available.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.javadoc:
Return the previous Record or null if one is not available.
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs
methods.name: previous
methods.comment: Return the previous Record or null if one is not available.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs

methods.name: delete
methods.comment: Delete the last Record read via the next or previous methods.

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs.

return.comment: true if record was successfully deleted.

name: RecordIterator
comment:
RecordIterator provides the ability to iterate over
 data records within a table.
